head.title: Kidnapping and Assault Bring a 19-Year Sentence

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Kidnapping and Assault Bring a 19-Year Sentence

abstract.p: State Supreme Court Justice Budd Goodman sentences Richard Blau to 19 years to life in prison for kidnapping and sexually abusing immigrant woman he chained in closet of his Washington Heights, New York City, apartment (S)

block.p: A Manhattan man who pleaded guilty to kidnapping and sexually abusing an immigrant woman during an 11-day attack was sentenced yesterday to 19 years to life in state prison.
In passing sentence, Justice Budd Goodman of State Supreme Court told the man, Richard Blau, that the case was ''one of the most heinous crimes that I have ever experienced in my years on the bench.
A Manhattan man who pleaded guilty to kidnapping and sexually abusing an immigrant woman during an 11-day attack was sentenced yesterday to 19 years to life in state prison.
In passing sentence, Justice Budd Goodman of State Supreme Court told the man, Richard Blau, that the case was ''one of the most heinous crimes that I have ever experienced in my years on the bench.
''I hope you will never see the light of day,'' Justice Goodman said.
Mr. Blau, 45, sat in a wheelchair throughout the sentencing. He suffers from a heart condition and other ailments.

Prosecutors had charged that Mr. Blau chained the 31-year-old woman in a closet of his Washington Heights apartment and repeatedly tortured and sexually abused her. He pleaded guilty to 12 counts, including sodomy, sexual abuse, attempted rape, assault and kidnapping.

Kathryn Jones, the assistant district attorney who prosecuted the case, said: ''The defendant will receive a substantial state prison sentence in exchange for his plea. The victim will be spared describing once again the hell she suffered at the hands of the defendant.''
